results.title: Pat and Mike
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn are sparring partners in this punchy comedy, of two good sports who stage a never ending romantic battle. Katharine Hepburn plays “Pat”, an all-round woman athlete who is a whiz at golf, tennis, baseball, basketball, boxing, archery and Judo. Spencer Tracy superbly enacts the part of “Mike”, an unschooled, rough-mannered Broadway promoter who already has a racing horse, and a heavy-weight fighter (Aldo Ray) as “clients” and who, possessing the top horse is now determined to have the “top woman”.

results.title: Dick Hickey: blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Lorne Batchelor, Dave Bennett and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The blacksmith shop as a place for home-spun philosophy, where the village old-timers gather around the smithy stove to listen as the blacksmith, personified by Dick Hickey, goes about his work and shares his reflections about old times and the blacksmith’s craft.

results.title: Dick Deadeye or duty done
results.creator_credit: Bill Melendez, Steven Cuitlahuac Melendez and Bill Melendez Productions
results.brief_description: This animated jaunty rollick of music, comedy and quirky little characters is based on the orginal works of Gilbert and Sullivan (including some new lyrics by Robin Miller) and features the voices of Victor Spinetti, Peter Reeves, George A. Cooper, Miriam Karlin, John Newton.

results.title: Dick
results.creator_credit: Andrew Fleming, Gale Anne Hurd, Pacific Western and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Betsy and Arlene are typical American girls growing up in the seventies - they love platform shoes, television and talking about David Cassidy. One night the two accidentally witness the Watergate break in and the next day whilst visiting the Whitehouse, President Richard Nixon (‘call me Dick’) decides to hire the girls as dog walkers in order to keep a close eye on them. The pair idolise their leader until they witness a slew of dubious incidents that lead them to believe that Dick may not be an honest man. Leaking information to Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward of the Washington Post, these two legendary news hounds are depicted as vainglorious, petty and just a little dim. As the story hots up Betsy and Arlene suspect they are being trailed and bugged by Dick’s cronies. Could these two spunky friends possibly be the infamous deepthroat? “Dick” is a comedy that lovingly sends up the frivolously upbeat world of the female teen, and is backed by a funky 70s soundtrack. The film succeeds as a satire of American politics and the press whilst reliving a particularly lurid period in fashion that revelled in a gaudy aesthetic. Kirsten Dunst and Michelle Williams are superbly funny in the lead roles.

results.title: Diary of a teenage smoker
results.creator_credit: Kari Skogland, Rachel Low, Daphne Ballon, Health and Welfare Canada and Atlantis Films
results.brief_description: Young women talk about the damaging effects that cigarettes have had on their lives. This video was produced with the cooperation and involvement of teenagers themselves. They recount their reasons for taking up smoking, the physical, emotional and financial costs of addiction, and their struggles to give up the habit. Never didactic, this straightforward account of tobacco addiction also uses dramatised sequences to explore the ways in which the cigarette industry targets young female smokers. Canadian comedian, Sandra Shamus, appears in the video delivering a monologue on her battle to give up the “deadly weed”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kari Skogland, Rachel Low, Daphne Ballon, Health and Welfare Canada and Atlantis Films

results.title: Diary of a chambermaid = Le Journal d'une femme de chambre
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Michael Sabra, Serge Silberman, DEAR Film, Filmsonor, Cine Alliance and Speva
results.brief_description: Celestine (Jeanne Moreau) takes up a post as chambermaid to a middle-class family and becomes the catalyst that reveals their sexual, religious and social repressions. The film, foot fetishism and all, is pure Bunuel, a sharp social satire in which the sexy, cruel and cool Moreau is wonderful. Loosely based on the novel by Octave Mirbeau.

results.title: Diary of a chambermaid
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Benedict Bogeaus, Burgess Meredith and Republic Films
results.brief_description: Chambermaid Celestine, (Paulette Goddard), a determined young woman wanting to improve her position and willing to use all her assets to do so. She climbs her way up through the various men in her life; her weak master Monsieur Lanlaire (Reginald Owen), his frail son George, (Hurd Hatfield), an eccentric flower-eating farmer/soldier Captain Mauger (Burgess Meredith), and the ruthless valet Joseph (Francis Lederer). What ensues is scandal, blackmail and murder. This was Renoir’s fourth American film, based on the novel by Octave Mirabeau.

results.title: Diana: story of a princess
results.creator_credit: Janice Sutherland, Phil Craig, Nick Ward, Sally Brindle and Brook Lapping Productions
results.brief_description: This four part television series is adapted from the book of the same name, retracing the life and mixed fortunes of Diana, Princess of Wales. The four part series features extensive interviews including: Diana’s staff, the press, royal biographers, photographers, friends, lovers, former colleagues as well as James Hewitt, Trevor Rhys-Jones and numerous people that Diana had met on tour. The documentary uses fictional “recreations” of certain scenes, voice-over narration and television footage to trace Diana’s life. Episode one: Diana’s life pre-royal marriage, her parents, birth, childhood, school years, employment in child care, engagement and marriage to Prince Charles, the rise of her popularity with the press. Episode 2: Ascendency of Diana’s fame and the press’s obsession with her, eclipsing Charles, cracks in the Royal marriage, the affair between Camilla and Charles, Diana’s popularity with the people and common touch. Episode 3: Diana’s affair with James Hewitt, the rival biographies, the Charles and Diana TV interviews, the divorce, Camilla gate, Diana gate, the rival camps and press obsession with the unravelling of the monarchy. Episode 4: Diana’s post-divorce suitors, fame in America, charity work with victims of landmines and AIDS, the press’s hounding of her, her romance with Dodi Al Fayed, death in Paris and subsequent public mourning of her life.

results.title: Passage west. Program 1: A dream of freedom
results.creator_credit: Philip Donnellan, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An examination of the great wave of British emigration to North America in the 19th century, based on historical documents, correspondence of the immigrants, and firsthand interviews with their descendents. A comparison is made with the plight of the modern immigrant.
